meanings.definition: Failure to fulfill an obligation, especially a financial one.
meanings.sent1: When he didn't pay back the loan, his default caused a lot of problems.
meanings.sent2: The company went bankrupt due to multiple defaults on their loans.
meanings.sent3: His habit of defaulting on payments became a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The default on the mortgage was a heavy weight on their shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of his financial defaults were severe and long-lasting.

meanings.definition: A preselected option adopted by a computer program or other mechanism when no alternative is specified.
meanings.sent1: The software's default setting was easy to change to suit individual preferences.
meanings.sent2: The default font size on the document was too small for comfortable reading.
meanings.sent3: The default choice on the website made the user experience smooth and efficient.
meanings.sent4: She always stuck with the default settings on her phone, never bothering to customize them.
meanings.sent5: The default option on the app made navigation simple and intuitive.

meanings.definition: To fail to fulfill an obligation, especially a financial one.
meanings.sent1: He defaults on his rent every month, causing stress for his landlord.
meanings.sent2: If you default on your loan, your credit score will be negatively affected.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to default on her promise to bring dessert to the party.
meanings.sent4: The company's decision to default on their debt led to legal consequences.
meanings.sent5: He chose to default on his responsibilities, leading to a loss of trust from his colleagues.
